comment: This class is a lot of work but Professor Inks cares a lot about the material and students success. He makes the material engaging through outside gamification where bonus points can be earned and the final can even become optional. Definitely not for people who are looking for an easy grade. I would take the class again though.

Ignore the dramatic reviews, this class does not have to be hard if you just LISTEN. Mr. Inks gives very clear instructions for everything; I was able to get extra credit/points multiple times and skip the final. The work is not hard except roleplay 4, you just need to prepare. Mr. Inks is funny and cares about his students. Watch his lectures!!!

Definitely a class I really enjoyed and that I learned a lot from. Dr. Inks is so nice and funny. The class is only hard if you take it for granted. His lecture videos are useful and funny, and unless you watch them, you won't do well on the quizzes or sales call role plays. Pointagram can also help you secure some great rewards and extra credit.

Before this semester I was scared for Inks class, but its truly not as bad as it seems & he genuinely wants to teach and help us. Theres a lot of work and material to learn, but its manageable once you get the hang of it. Roleplays are confusing at first but not bad either. Just do the work, watch the videos, & communicate with him, hes a good prof
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Want an A? Read the syllabus and ask questions. Go to class. Get a halfway decent group. LEARN AND PRACTICE EXCELL. This class is designed to weed you out but he will give you every opportunity to pass. He does his best to not make this class hard (which it isn't if you simply go to class). Go to class + group work + excell = A

This is not an easy A class, but Professor Ink offers plenty of opportunities to pass the class. 45% of your overall grade relies on 4 roleplays, and the rest of the grade is dependent on you. He lets you know day one this class requires effort. If you are not willing to put in the work don't take the class.
Do not take him.

Took this as an online summer course. If you want to pursue sales, I highly recommend it because you will learn. He provides a lot of resources and I definitely learned about sales. The course does require a lot of effort and work, so I wouldn't recommend taking it as a summer course. The professor is tough but does a good job of actually teaching.

Professor Inks is not the worst professor I have ever had, but he is just not worth taking. He claims 40% of the class is daily work, but grades it like he is an English professor. In depth lectures every week, which require discussions, and a final sales pitch that is not easy. Overall not worth taking.

He makes the final exam optional, but what I think he should do is make role play 4 optional instead. Role play 3 is basically the same as role play 4, which I think is unnecessary for us to do. Role play 04 just drops your grade, which SUCKS.

The coursework for this class was heavy, but manageable. There are weekly quizzes and discussion posts, along with 4-7 weekly lecture videos. Role plays are also required. The first 2 role plays were great and fun, but the last two are just unnecessary. He says its good "practice." NOT REALLY. Grades very harshly on role plays 3 & 4- tanks ur grade
Don't take him. You could do well all semester, and then the last sales role play could TANK your grade. he is a passionate professor but the weight of his grading stinks.

Professor Inks is one of the best upper-level professors I've had. His lectures are high-quality and humorous at points. Regarding the lectures, many of his quizzes are lecture-oriented so it's important to take good notes, even on the little things. I wouldn't say his grading is harsh but more mild so it's important to produce quality work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly, I have never written a review for any professor. Professor Inks is by far one of my favorites! He responds very quickly and your main goal is to be engaged in this course and you will succeed.

Dr. Inks is a very underrated professor! He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed in sales. Yes, his class can be challenging at times, but this is done to grow and develop your skills; whether that is in Excel or PowerPoint. Just be ready to learn Excel as he gives graded assignments on it. Do this and you'll be in good shape.

Professor Inks was one of my favorite professors and I grew so much taking his class. There is A LOT of work, however it is truly all relevant to professional development and helping students prepare for careers. As long as you're prepared to apply yourself, you'll do great! He is extremely knowledgeable about sales and passionate about teaching.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Inks has by far been the hardest professor I've taken yet. I wouldn't necessarily say his feed back is unclear(although needs some work).I rather found it to give me information overload. WAY too may instructions, WAY too many assignments, and bias grading(In relation to the discussion posts). If you can avoid him, PLEASE do!

Professor Inks was one of the best I have had at KSU. If you are in you are looking for a professor whose class is going to teach you things you are going to take with you TAKE HIM.  I strongly recommend taking this professor if you are looking for someone to keep you accountable, and ultimately make you have a sense of worth for your career.

I actually learned from this course bc of the way its designed. He does try to add busy work that is annoying. There are weekly videos, DP, and a quiz. The quiz is the textbook and the videos. its lockdown no webcam. there are also role plays.
Grades very strictly. Toughest professor at KSU.

Prof Inks is a really good teacher. You can tell he enjoys the sales field & likes to see his students succeed. There were several sales call role-plays you did with a partner during the class. It was fun to get to know someone in a class, but they were very time consuming. Weekly discussion posts, open-book quizzes, & variety of other assignments.

By far the TOUGHEST Sales professor at KSU. I am not opposed to hard work, but the amount of work given in this class is completely unnecessary for the subject. The worst thing about this professor is hell give you very VAGUE feedback, and then give you a terrible grade for not following instructions. Does not know how to get instructions across

If youre not a Professional Sales major, DO NOT TAKE!! This man takes his class WAY too seriously. His grading feedback is very vague so you really know how good/bad you did on an assignment until he decides to input grades. He grades very tough on the sales call, despite not being much help at all. Dont take if you have no real interest in sales

If you hate sales, don't take him. He takes his professional sales class (online) way too seriously. He grades way too harshly, and will make you do a sales roll call with him, which will be 25% of your grade. He does not take into account that not everyone wants to be in sales, or that this class is mandatory for many, but not wanted. Don't do it.

He clearly cares a lot about his students. The difficulty of this class come mainly from poor online translation. He doesn't keep the course calendar updated so it's very difficult to stay on top of deadlines.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Inks is extremely intelligent and cares about the students learning. I will say, the structure is disorganized, so you can't really plan for assignments or projects more that 4-5 days before they're due. He is also very vague but he does that so you can show your abilities to go above and beyond. Hard but 100% the most useful class i've ever had
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Inks is a GREAT guy. Hilarious and engaging lectures. He does not do the best job explaining assignments so you really have to pry what he wants you to do out of him. the class is hard, and there is a lot of excel work. But it has benefited me a lot in the workplace. If you show him you are working at it, you will be okay. 100% take this course.

Inks was a great guy, funny too. However his level of organization throughout the whole semester was stressful. The grading system is a mess to figure out what your grade is and his instructions were very vague. I feel like he tried to put way too much into one semester and realized it wasn't working out and stressing out students.

Dr. Inks is hysterical and I enjoyed going to class because he speaks to his students conversationally. He was awesome about bringing visitors to class so that way you had plenty of networking opportunities. My only issues were he wasn't always clear with assignment instructions and wanted assignments emailed. He also didn't always upload lectures.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Inks is awesome. He's intense, engaging, and hilarious. He gives pop quizzes every other lecture that are usually easy if you show up to class and take notes. There is homework and online quizzes due every Sunday. The online quizzes are tough if you don't do a good job learning the content. Final exam is a sales call roleplay with him.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: He's a great teacher! He really cares about that you get something out of his class. He has different speakers from jobs looking for interns and potential new employees.  Have to dress up once a week. Pop quizzes, but they are so easy and if you pay attention he gives you the answers in the question. Sales roll call plays suck but you'll live.

Dr. Inks is really cool. He's good at what he does and he makes his lectures really fun. The role plays are intimidating early in the semester, but he gives you a lot of practice and tips to succeed. I thoroughly enjoy his class. Also, there are guest speakers almost every week that are a great chance to network and get an internship. Take him!
